programme.title: Le divorce
Rozwód po francusku
Le Divorce
programme.desc:
Le divorce: Directed by James Ivory. With Kate Hudson, Jean-Marie Lhomme, Naomi Watts, Esmée Buchet-Deàk. French vs. American social customs and behaviors are observed in a story about an American visiting her Frenchman-wed sister in Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0306734/","name":"Le divorce","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxMjQ0MDgzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjM1MDY2._V1_.jpg","description":"French vs. American social customs and behaviors are observed in a story about an American visiting her Frenchman-wed sister in Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0306734/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MLDinTN"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just another movie...","reviewBody":"you wonder why they ever spent money to make. It wasn't terrible, but not much happens. It didn't entertain me. Isabel goes to Paris to visit her pregnant sister, Roxanne. Upon arriving, she sees Roxanne's husband leaving her. So, she tries to cheer her sister up and has an affair with a married relative of the husband. He buys her an expensive purse and everyone knows they're hooking up. A side plot involves a painting that belongs to Roxanne's family. She doesn't want her husband to get it in the divorce. They decide to sell it and find out it's worth millions. So, now the 2 sisters have some money to start the new chapter in their lives.

I don't think it was a romance film and it sure wasn't funny. I would describe it as bland.

FINAL VERDICT: It may put you to sleep, so I wouldn't recommend it unless you are suffering from insomnia."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-08-29","keywords":"american,french,love,sex,france","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Le Divorce","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1636958489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODIxZDhmOTUtZDE5OS00M2RlLWJkM2ItYjQxMjE2YWE0MjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODIxZDhmOTUtZDE5OS00M2RlLWJkM2ItYjQxMjE2YWE0MjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pre"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005028/","name":"Kate Hudson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915208/","name":"Naomi Watts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000330/","name":"Stockard Channing"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412465/","name":"James Ivory"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055367/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424956/","name":"Diane Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695609/","name":"Ruth Prawer Jhabvala"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412465/","name":"James Ivory"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wyzwanie - nowe mieszkanie 14
programme.desc: Prowadzący Damian Urbańczyk będzie szukał idealnego lokum dla osób o rozmaitych wymaganiach i budżetach. Pojawią się m.in. niedrogie mieszkania w blokach z wielkiej płyty, apartamenty w nowych inwestycjach czy luksusowy dom pod Warszawą za kilka milionów złotych. Widzowie zobaczą, co oferuje polski rynek nieruchomości. Poznają też kolejne praktyczne porady.

programme.title: Cena dziewictwa
programme.desc: Dokumentalistka Feriel Ben Mahmoud sprawdza, jak wygląda traktowanie dziewictwa w różnych miejscach świata. Mimo rewolucji seksualnej, moda na wstrzemięźliwość i czystość nadal jest popularna w wielu krajach, kulturach i religiach. Świadczą o tym m.in. organizowane bale czystości. Reżyserka chce poznać przyczyny takiego stanu rzeczy, a przy okazji obala wiele mitów na temat dziewictwa.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga francuska - mecz: Lille OSC - Angers SCO
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix po raz kolejny sprawdzi, jak szefowie kuchni poradzą sobie z rzuconymi przez niego wyzwaniami. Zadaniem uczestników programu będzie przygotowanie przekąsek, które uwielbiają Brytyjczycy. Ich pracę ocenią pracownicy fabryk, w których produkuje się dany przysmak.

programme.title: Mistrzowie przekąsek w akcji 2

programme.title: Baggage Claim
Bez bagażu
Baggage Claim
programme.desc: Baggage Claim: Directed by David E. Talbert. With Paula Patton, Derek Luke, Taye Diggs, Boris Kodjoe. Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancé." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1171222/","name":"Baggage Claim","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNDU4NTY3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTA3MDA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancé.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1171222/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kayceeroy"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A waste of a movie for such good talent!","reviewBody":"I have no idea whether or not Paula Patton actually read the script before signing up for the role, but this movie certainly does little to nothing but justify her talents. If you've watched her in Deja Vu, then this movie will strike you as the lowest she's ever sunken in her movie roles. The storyline is very weak to say the least. You can literally guess what will happen from one scene to the very last, including the credits. I felt sorry for actors like Trey Songz. If he is serious about acting, this may not have been a good movie to make his first impression in. The movie's attempt at humor was also poor. There was only one joke the audience laughed at in the whole movie. I am not surprised the movie was pulled out from the theaters in my neighborhood after only a few days. It is one that belongs to the DVDs.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9117,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2013-09-27","keywords":"gay character,woman wears only a man's shirt,marriage proposal,karaoke bar,karaoke","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1964549657","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTEzOTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY4MzA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTEzOTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY4MzA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancÃ©."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1745736/","name":"Paula Patton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004875/","name":"Taye Diggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779325/","name":"Jill Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0847859/","name":"David E. programme.title: Jestem Andrzejem
programme.desc: Marek, introwertyczny informatyk po trzydziestce, próbuje odnaleźć się w szalonym świecie swojej młodszej dziewczyny Julki. W wyniku kłótni para się rozstaje. Marek samotnie wraca do domu, przechodząc przez ulicę zostaje śmiertelnie potrącony przez samochód. W ten sposób trafia do zaświatów. Dzięki pomocy tajemniczego chłopaka udaje mu się wrócić do żywych.

Bartosz Lisek

programme.title: Nie bój ryby!
programme.desc: Bartosz Lisek pracował jako kucharz okrętowy. Chcąc urozmaicić żeglarską dietę, składającą się głównie z makaronu i mielonki, odwiedzał targi w każdym porcie. Kupował tam świeże ryby i różnorodne owoce morza. Teraz dzieli się przepisami, nad którymi pracował przez lata. Podpowiada też, które ryby są najzdrowsze. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy smakowite propozycje - przystawkę, zupę i drugie danie.

Great Expectations
programme.desc:
Great Expectations: Directed by Alfonso Cuarón. With Ethan Hawke, Gwyneth Paltrow, Hank Azaria, Chris Cooper. Modernization of Charles Dickens' classic story finds the hapless Finn as a painter in New York City pursuing his unrequited and haughty childhood love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119223/","name":"Great Expectations","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDFiODQ3ZmEtZDQwYS00ZmQ4LWIxYzItYzM2YmVhNDRmZmFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTk5Nzg1NjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Modernization of Charles Dickens' classic story finds the hapless Finn as a painter in New York City pursuing his unrequited and haughty childhood love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Movie-12"},"dateCreated":"1999-07-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spellbinding from the first shot. Supurb performances. ***1/2 out of ****","reviewBody":"Great Expectations (1998) ***1/2 

Starring: Ethan Hawke, Gwyneth Paltrow, Anne Bancroft, Chris Cooper, Robert DeNiro and Kim Dickens Director: Alfonso Cuaron 111 minutes Rated R

By Blake French: 

The only thing keeping "Great Expectations" from being one of the best films of the year is the dialogue, which is too proper. The characters act like the everything they do must be out of perfection. When in reality, some of the film's characters would be gruff, careless people.

The movie is spellbinding from the first shot. That is undoubtfully because of the character development, which so many movies fail at these days. And not only are they adequately developed, they are engaging. The audience can relate to them as well as understand them. Now these are signs of a superb movie in the making. 

The movie opens with a small boy, about ten years of age, being overtaken by a man who we later learn is a death sentenced escapee. He orders the pedestrian to bring selected materials to him early the next morning, and never to tell a soul of his terrifying experience. He does as he is told.

 The boy is named Finnegan Bell, a poor, unfortunate child who lives with his older sister and her husband. The uncle, Joe, soon excepts a job from an extraordinarily eccentric mistress, Ms. Dinsmoor, and her spoiled daughter, Estella. Under circumstances, Finn is able to meet the young girls, about ten years of age as well, and later on becomes close friends with her and the woman 

Years pass, Finn is still inevitably attracted to Estella, despite her emotionless personality. Unfortunately, she leaves the state to study her future career. Finn is devastated. He gives up his wonderful talent of art and goes into cruise drive for the next seven years. 

An offer is made to him almost a decade later, to move to New York, where Estella lives at this time, and pursue a career as a professional artist. He excepts, and soon after he arrives, his paths cross with his love once again, but things aren't as they seem at first sight. 

Do Finn and Estella follow a life of marriage together? Is Estella still interested in Finn, or does she have other romantic plans? I will not revel the answers to these questions. I will leave it up to you to watch this masterpiece destined to become a romantic classic. However, I will say that if you are not familiar with this old tale from Charles Dickens, things are very unpredictable, and this is not you typical, run-of-the-mill love story.

 The performances are truly Oscar worthy, too bad I didn't see this movie when I came out. For I am reviewing it a year later, because I saw it on video, for free, that is. But I certainly would have paid full price to screen this gem, just to tell others how mesmerizing it is.

 	I loved Anne Bancroft, as the crazy widow. She is gorgeous, breathtaking, and one of a kind, as is Paltrow, as Estella herself. Ethan Hawke performs a down-to-earth character with interest and convincing situation. Chris Cooper, Robert DeNiro and Kim Dickens all provide strong supporting role, especially De Niro, but none are on screen enough to make an actual mark.

 Another beautiful element in "Great Expectations" is the production design: in the houses the atmosphere is all lush, glamorous and interesting. It provides the characters with a firm foundation, which they certainly take advantage of. As a matter of fact, everyone involved with the creation of the film takes careful interest into everything they do. For this is one of the most luscious movies of the decade.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52728,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1998-01-30","keywords":"estella character,whiskey,cigarette,love,gulf coast","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Great Expectations (1998)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi715850009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFmY2UxMDktNTZkYi00MGQ3LTk2Y2QtZDdlN2FmMTZjM2JlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFmY2UxMDktNTZkYi00MGQ3LTk2Y2QtZDdlN2FmMTZjM2JlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000160/","name":"Ethan Hawke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000569/","name":"Gwyneth Paltrow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000279/","name":"Hank Azaria"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079747/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002042/","name":"Charles Dickens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322248/","name":"Mitch Glazer"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Natalia Sosin

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 2
programme.desc: Dla wielu ludzi już sama wizja remontu jest niezwykle stresująca. Obawy okazują się uzasadnione, gdy pracownicy niesprawdzonych firm remontowych wyrządzają niewybaczalne szkody. Drugi sezon programu, w którym ceniony specjalista budowlany, Wiesław Skiba, naprawi błędy popełnione przez niekompetentnych kolegów po fachu oraz podpowie widzom, jak samodzielnie uporać się z drobnymi usterkami.

programme.title: Jagny Niedzielskiej kuchnia bez resztek
programme.desc: Jagna Niedzielska, szefowa kuchni oraz popularyzatorka nurtu zero waste, prezentuje sposoby na gotowanie bez marnowania żywności. Prowadząca pokaże, jak najefektywniej wykorzystywać dostępne w naszej kuchni produkty, aby zminimalizować ich straty do zera.

programme.title: Jagny Niedzielskiej kuchnia bez resztek

programme.title: Rugby: Autumn Nations Series - mecz: Szkocja - Australia
programme.desc: Iwona Zasuwa, autorka bloga Smakoterapia, zaskakuje pomysłowością dań dla dzieci. Gotuje w towarzystwie mam i ich pociech. Oprócz ciekawych pomysłów na potrawy przygotowywane z myślą o najmłodszych, gospodyni programu podzieli się także wieloma praktycznymi radami na temat tego co, jak i kiedy serwować swoim milusińskim. Ponadto eksperci wytłumaczą, dlaczego pewne produkty szkodzą, a inne mają zbawienny wpływ na zdrowie zarówno dzieci, jak i rodziców.

programme.title: Mistrzowie przekąsek w akcji 2
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix po raz kolejny sprawdzi, jak szefowie kuchni poradzą sobie z rzuconymi przez niego wyzwaniami. Zadaniem uczestników programu będzie przygotowanie przekąsek, które uwielbiają Brytyjczycy. Ich pracę ocenią pracownicy fabryk, w których produkuje się dany przysmak.

programme.title: Frankie
Frankie
programme.desc:
Frankie: Directed by Ira Sachs. With Isabelle Huppert, Sennia Nanua, Ariyon Bakare, Vinette Robinson. Three generations grappling with a life-changing experience during one day of a vacation in Sintra, Portugal, a historic town known for its dense gardens and fairy-tale villas and palaces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8019694/","name":"Frankie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjgwYTIwNWYtMjg4ZS00YTY0LWEzN2YtMzI1NWFlMzFkODM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTgxNDIzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three generations grappling with a life-changing experience during one day of a vacation in Sintra, Portugal, a historic town known for its dense gardens and fairy-tale villas and palaces.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8019694/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"levybob"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"AS THOUGH EVERYONE WERE READING THEIR LINES","reviewBody":"I saw 'Frankie' today (Oct. 6, 2019) at the Mill Valley Film Festival. A more slow-moving, uninteresting film would be hard to find. Other critics of the film have done a good job of laying out the plot, so I won't take up your time. My low rating is based on the low (lowest) energy that this film puts out. It is as though no one has the energy to show emotion. As though the Portugal heat has had its effect on everyone. But more than anything else the film runs as though it were a table-read; actors with script in hand, doing a first read at a table. The camera work is leisurely at best. This could be a TV soap-opera episode as easily as a theatrical film.

And for that there's no excuse.

Then why, you might ask, the four stars. For Ms. Tomei and Mrs. Hupert, that's why.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1590,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-08-28","keywords":"character name as title,one word title,female protagonist,singing,swimming pool","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1866972185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNiZDg5ZTEtYzMwMi00ZWRiLThkZTctYzA5NmE4YTIwZjYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNiZDg5ZTEtYzMwMi00ZWRiLThkZTctYzA5NmE4YTIwZjYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Unfolding over the course of a late summer's day in the fabled resort town of Sintra, Portugal, 'Frankie' follows three generations who have gathered for a vacation organized by the family matriarch (Isabelle Huppert). In this fairy tale setting, husbands and wives, parents and children, friends and lovers -- stirred by their romantic impulses -- discover the cracks between them, as well as unexpected depth of feeling."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6451469/","name":"Sennia Nanua"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048159/","name":"Ariyon Bakare"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0755158/","name":"Ira Sachs"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315467/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029411/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0663541/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0755158/","name":"Ira Sachs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951592/","name":"Mauricio Zacharias"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

My low rating is based on the low (lowest) energy that this film puts out. It is as though no one has the energy to show emotion. As though the Portugal heat has had its effect on everyone. programme.title: The Nest
Gniazdo zła
Il nido
programme.desc:
The Nest (Il nido): Directed by Roberto De Feo. With Francesca Cavallin, Ginevra Francesconi, Justin Korovkin, Maurizio Lombardi. Samuel is a paraplegic boy who lives with his mother Elena in an isolated mansion. When he meets Denise, he finds the strength to open up to the world. Elena won't let him go so easily, and she is ready to do whatever it takes to stop him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4925340/","name":"The Nest (Il nido)","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgyZTQ2NTctMzczZC00OGE5LWE3ZTUtYWJkMjAzMTQ0MWQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIwNDY4NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Samuel is a paraplegic boy who lives with his mother Elena in an isolated mansion. When he meets Denise, he finds the strength to open up to the world. Elena won't let him go so easily, and she is ready to do whatever it takes to sto","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4925340/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"andrealeonti"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"De Feo's "The Nest" may represent the rebirth of a long forgotten genre like the italian horror","reviewBody":"Let's be clear: horror is a genre that in Italy has been forgotten for about 20-25 years. After ancient glories and masterpieces signed by worldwide-acclaimed masters such as Argento, Fulci, Avati and Bava, horror cinema seems to have totally disappeared from national screens.

Roberto De Feo's "The Nest" is the breath of rebirth and resurrection of a long forgotten genre. The Nest is a horror that does not point to fear or disgust with particular visual artifices, but adheres to a more suspended, obscure and implicit line like Robert Eggers' "The Witch". Except for two or three visually more decisive and explicit sequences (placed however in a timely manner and not inopportune) it is a film that is based on dark atmospheres, on a sense of anguish and on a feeling that something strange is about to occur. It is a horror that also presents very delicate sequences, not trivial and well cohesive with the rest of the work. A fairly predictable end, however, if one takes into account the clues given here and there in the film and the narrative evolution of the story. An ending that presents nothing innovative, but well cohesive with the premise built by the film.

On a technical level, it presents a really beautiful and extremely accurate photography, moreover being a horror, and an Italian horror. From the directorial style it would be very plausible to believe that it is an Anglo-Saxon or American production. De Feo's direction is obscure, punctual, precise, elegant, enveloping but also sufficiently detached. Actorial evidence is positive on the whole, except for some high and low of some actors.

The Nest could be the rebirth of a new wave of Italian horror, and I sincerely hope that it is not a beacon of darkness destined, inexorably, to go out to make a long-forgotten genre return to oblivion.

7.5/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1327,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-08-15","keywords":"gothic horror,mansion,mother son relation,shot to death,suicide by hanging","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tráiler [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2151661337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjIzZDYzNTYtZmQ5Ny00ZTdhLTkyYWItYzY2Zjk2OTJkOTkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjIzZDYzNTYtZmQ5Ny00ZTdhLTkyYWItYzY2Zjk2OTJkOTkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1596920/","name":"Francesca Cavallin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9698919/","name":"Ginevra Francesconi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9059090/","name":"Justin Korovkin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3248608/","name":"Roberto De Feo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280251/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022818/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3248608/","name":"Roberto De Feo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7505663/","name":"Lucio Besana"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3275885/","name":"Margherita Ferri"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
25 lat niewinności. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
programme.desc:
25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy: Directed by Jan Holoubek. With Piotr Trojan, Agata Kulesza, Dariusz Chojnacki, Jan Frycz. The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11368998/","name":"25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2E3YWNhMTgtMzRiZS00N2UxLWJkYzEtOGYyMWFhNDhlZmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11368998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"v-26640"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful movie about how person can be sentenced on circumstantial evidences.","reviewBody":"Tomasz Komenda was sentenced about 3 years after the crime had been committed basing on simple idea - 'find me a man and we fill forge evidences against him'. What this move does not show is that at that time Attorney General, now deceased Lech Kaczynski had been urged that a killer is found and sentenced to silence medias hysteria and coverage about brutal murder and rape of that young girl. Later when the murder was put on Tomasz, he was publicly defamed by Lech Kaczynski. Despite Mr L. Kaczynski death in Smolensk plane crash and after Tomasz was exonerated, no polish public institution nor police have never apologized Tomasz for their actions, which is a standard practice in western democratic countries.

Not much changed in post-soviet bloc however after 1990 in terms of judiciary mentality. Human Rights Watch estimates that 1-3% of sentences in Poland may be those in which innocent people are sentenced just because either suspects were threatened by police to force to confess by beatings. No effective police control and their procedures exists as of today. You may call it a mafia or not but I believe it's not far from truth in Poland.

Personally I believe his family did not do enough to get him out of prison, a good lawyer would smash the case easily and he is worth every money, why did it happen 15 years later is a mystery for me.

IMDb data; ttnr: 11368998, Title: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy, --- Description: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy: Directed by Jan Holoubek. With Piotr Trojan, Agata Kulesza, Dariusz Chojnacki, Jan Frycz. The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11368998/","name":"25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2E3YWNhMTgtMzRiZS00N2UxLWJkYzEtOGYyMWFhNDhlZmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11368998/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"v-26640","dateCreated":"2021-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful movie about how person can be sentenced on circumstantial evidences.","reviewBody":"Tomasz Komenda was sentenced about 3 years after the crime had been committed basing on simple idea - 'find me a man and we fill forge evidences against him'. What this move does not show is that at that time Attorney General, now deceased Lech Kaczynski had been urged that a killer is found and sentenced to silence medias hysteria and coverage about brutal murder and rape of that young girl. Later when the murder was put on Tomasz, he was publicly defamed by Lech Kaczynski. Despite Mr L. Kaczynski death in Smolensk plane crash and after Tomasz was exonerated, no polish public institution nor police have never apologized Tomasz for their actions, which is a standard practice in western democratic countries.

Not much changed in post-soviet bloc however after 1990 in terms of judiciary mentality. Human Rights Watch estimates that 1-3% of sentences in Poland may be those in which innocent people are sentenced just because either suspects were threatened by police to force to confess by beatings. No effective police control and their procedures exists as of today. You may call it a mafia or not but I believe it's not far from truth in Poland.

Personally I believe his family did not do enough to get him out of prison, a good lawyer would smash the case easily and he is worth every money, why did it happen 15 years later is a mystery for me.

As Tomasz said after his release, there are no good people in prisons , there is only evil.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":864,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-18","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3825975/","name":"Piotr Trojan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0474492/","name":"Agata Kulesza","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2621963/","name":"Dariusz Chojnacki"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015575/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1733303/","name":"Andrzej Golda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"],"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wino truskawkowe
Wino truskawkowe
programme.desc: Wino truskawkowe: Directed by Dariusz Jablonski. With Jirí Machácek, Zuzana Fialová, Marian Dziedziel, Mieczyslaw Grabka. This is not a love story though it is full of love. It is not a comedy though the characters often say funny things. It is not a detective story even though the hero is trying to solve a murder. It is not a nature drama though it shows the splendid colours and customs of the countryside. It is not a musical though Lubica expresses her longing in a passionate dance. Nor is it a film about ghosts though a ghost does ask the hero for a favour. A few draughts of Strawberry Wine are enough to take us into a magical world in the true centre of Europe, where love, crime and penitence are just as much a part of life as the changing of the seasons, the migration of birds or the flowing of a mountain stream." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1260596/","name":"Wino truskawkowe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI5MjU4YjUtNGJkNy00Nzk2LTgyYWEtMDk0OTBmY2NmZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTgyNDg0NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is not a love story though it is full of love. programme.desc: Najśmieszniejsze fragmenty z programów polskich stacji TV: gafy popełniane przez prezenterów, ich nietypowe zachowania przed kamerą oraz awarie techniczne powodujące absurdalne sytuacje.

programme.title: MTV Unplugged. Krzysztof Zalewski
programme.desc: Prowadzący luksusowe życie psiak Urwis po śmierci swojej pani ląduje na bruku. To dla niego prawdziwy szok. Kapryśny zwierzak musi dorosnąć. Czeka go prawdziwa lekcja przetrwania. Na szczęście poznaje nowych przyjaciół, na których może liczyć, a także sympatyczną początkującą piosenkarkę o wielkim sercu.

programme.title: 10 giorni senza mamma
Sami bez mamy
10 giorni senza mamma
programme.desc: 10 giorni senza mamma: Directed by Alessandro Genovesi. With Fabio De Luigi, Valentina Lodovini, Angelica Elli, Bianca Usai. What happens if an always present mother decides to leave for ten days, leaving the three children with a father who was practically absent until then." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8660788/","name":"10 giorni senza mamma","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUzMzhkMGYtOTU1Ni00Y2UzLWJkOTktMjg3ZWFjM2ExOTM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQ4MDQ4ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"What happens if an always present mother decides to leave for ten days, leaving the three children with a father who was practically absent until then.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8660788/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"avillamaina"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Usual stereotypes, moderate humour","reviewBody":"This movie builds on the nowadays common stereotypes where mothers don't have a job in spite of being truly brilliant, being able to steer through a myriad of daily chores and activities with kids while working fathers are completely useless, showing that they would never cope with switching roles, not even for 10 days. I find this rather sexist and insulting.\n\nApart from this there are some fun situations here and there, but overall it's just below average humour.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":987,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-02-07","keywords":"children,father son relationship,father daughter relationship,husband wife relationship,remake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer originale italiano [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi790018585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI2YzRiYmUtOTNmYy00MGM1LWIyYTItNzQzZTI3ZDlkYTkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI2YzRiYmUtOTNmYy00MGM1LWIyYTItNzQzZTI3ZDlkYTkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0209948/","name":"Fabio De Luigi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779438/","name":"Valentina Lodovini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10406294/","name":"Angelica Elli"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3500190/","name":"Alessandro Genovesi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030393/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4996440/","name":"Giovanni Bognetti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3500190/","name":"Alessandro Genovesi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893556/","name":"Juan Vera"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

Baggage Claim
programme.desc: Baggage Claim: Directed by David E. Talbert. With Paula Patton, Derek Luke, Taye Diggs, Boris Kodjoe. Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancé." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1171222/","name":"Baggage Claim","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNDU4NTY3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTA3MDA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancé.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1171222/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kayceeroy"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A waste of a movie for such good talent!","reviewBody":"I have no idea whether or not Paula Patton actually read the script before signing up for the role, but this movie certainly does little to nothing but justify her talents. If you've watched her in Deja Vu, then this movie will strike you as the lowest she's ever sunken in her movie roles. The storyline is very weak to say the least. You can literally guess what will happen from one scene to the very last, including the credits. I felt sorry for actors like Trey Songz. If he is serious about acting, this may not have been a good movie to make his first impression in. The movie's attempt at humor was also poor. There was only one joke the audience laughed at in the whole movie. I am not surprised the movie was pulled out from the theaters in my neighborhood after only a few days. It is one that belongs to the DVDs.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9117,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2013-09-27","keywords":"gay character,woman wears only a man's shirt,marriage proposal,karaoke bar,karaoke","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1964549657","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTEzOTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY4MzA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTEzOTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY4MzA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancÃ©."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1745736/","name":"Paula Patton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004875/","name":"Taye Diggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779325/","name":"Jill Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0847859/","name":"David E. programme.title: Volcano
Wulkan
Volcano
programme.desc:
Volcano: Directed by Mick Jackson. With Tommy Lee Jones, Anne Heche, Gaby Hoffmann, Don Cheadle. A volcano erupts in downtown Los Angeles and a city official and a seismologist try to stop its inevitable flow through the city." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120461/","name":"Volcano","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I2MTFiOWMtY2YzOC00MTZjLTg0NWUtMmZjZWJlZDYwZDZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A volcano erupts in downtown Los Angeles and a city official and a seismologist try to stop its inevitable flow through the city.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120461/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jpsaldibar"},"dateCreated":"2000-08-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"What America needs is a few good volcanic eruptions?","reviewBody":"As a Big Budget movie, I'm sure that "Volcano" took more than a few months to make. Too bad someone associated with the movie didn't take that time to wander into the local library (the children's section, perhaps), and check out a book on "Volcanoes". I've seen Saturday-morning cartoons that have a better understanding of lava.

Instead we get many scenes of outright stupidity that would challenge even the densest of viewers. In one scene, Tommy Lee Jones and an assistant are standing near a volcanic vent, and their protective suits start to melt (of course skin is stronger than a protective suit, so they escape unharmed). But in numerous later scenes, people walk by lava like you might walk past a lake. Maybe this is because no one seems to know it's lava. I lost count of how many times a character said something like "What is that stuff?" or "There's something really hot and glowing coming down the street, and things are melting into it. Wonder what it could be?"

In what has to be one of the worst scenes ever filmed, two characters load an injured man onto the outstretched ladder of a hook & ladder truck. Then they hang onto a dangling fire hose as the ladder is lifted above the lava. The heat is so intense that the fire hose SPONTANEOUSLY COMBUSTS, but our characters are unhurt (their boots smoke a little). I didn't know that fire hoses were so flammable...

But "Volcano"is not just a dumb disaster flick with bad science. No! It's also a Socially-Important Commentary on our Society Movie! Throughout the film there are numerous "social messages". These are so corny and contrived that they could only have been written by people who have never actually experienced them. A racist cop tries to arrest a guy for assault (in the middle of a disaster scene!), but then the two team up to help save the day. Aww. Later, a little kid notes that "everybody looks the same" when covered by ash and soot. Aww. America's racial troubles could be ended, if only a giant volcano threatened us all.

More? Oh sure, there's more! Tommy Lee Jones is the too-hard-working dad who comes to value his daughter. Said daughter is a selfish brat who learns some responsibility, and respect for her dad. There's a guy whose only role in the movie is to say obviously insulting things. This makes him the "bad guy". One can see the writers of this movie hammering his role out: "We need someone who's rich and yuppie-like and snooty. Someone like us, only not as enlightened. Someone who wouldn't make a Socially-Important Commentary on our Society Movie like we are!" Of course, bad things happen to him and all is right with the world.

In the end, the mysterious, glowing, sometimes-hot substance we come to know as "lava" is channeled into the sea, and all of LA lives happily ever after in a just and fair world. A world, of course, with a big smoking volcano plopped down into the middle of it. Certainly that won't affect the real estate values?

The lessons of this movie are quite clear. 1) lava is harmless if you don't touch it; 2) small children will inevitably wander into incredible harm (but emerge OK), and 3) only through the trauma of sudden volcanic activity will we come to appreciate the true Brotherhood of Man.

Whoever thought up this movie should be thrown into a volcano..."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74555,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1997-04-25","keywords":"la brea tar pits,lava bomb,firefighter,fire truck,1990s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Volcano","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi836829465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGI3MjMzMWEtMTM1YS00NmM2LTk1YTEtNzVjYThhOTQzZmUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGI3MjMzMWEtMTM1YS00NmM2LTk1YTEtNzVjYThhOTQzZmUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000162/","name":"Anne Heche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000451/","name":"Gaby Hoffmann"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413875/","name":"Mick Jackson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116435/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035749/","name":"Jerome Armstrong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712753/","name":"Billy Ray"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: My Salinger Year
Mój rok z Salingerem
My Salinger Year
programme.desc: My Salinger Year: Directed by Philippe Falardeau. With Margaret Qualley, Sigourney Weaver, Douglas Booth, Seána Kerslake. A college grad takes a clerical job working for the literary agent of the renowned, reclusive writer J.D. Salinger." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2222052/","name":"My Salinger Year","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzNDM4YWMtZWE5Ny00MTliLWEzY2ItODU0NmE2ZTUzMDhlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTE1MzI2NzIz._V1_.jpg","description":"A college grad takes a clerical job working for the literary agent of the renowned, reclusive writer J.D. Salinger.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2222052/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gordon-11"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Heartwarming","reviewBody":"It's not an eventful story, but somehow it really engages you with realistic characters and an engaging story. I find it heartwarming."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2982,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-03-05","keywords":"writer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer (2021)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi728351001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM5NjRkMzMtY2QyMi00Y2NmLWEyOTQtY2IwNWRmOTVmNTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM5NjRkMzMtY2QyMi00Y2NmLWEyOTQtY2IwNWRmOTVmNTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"New York in the 90s: After leaving graduate school to pursue her dream of becoming a writer, Joanna (Margaret Qualley) gets hired as an assistant to Margaret (Sigourney Weaver), the stoic and old-fashioned literary agent of J. D. Salinger. Fluctuating between poverty and glamour, she spends her days in a plush, wood-paneled office – where dictaphones and typewriters still reign and agents doze off after three-martini lunches – and her nights in a sink-less Brooklyn apartment with her socialist boyfriend. Joanna’s main task is processing Salinger’s voluminous fan mail, but as she reads the heart-wrenching letters from around the world, she becomes reluctant to send the agency’s impersonal standard letter and impulsively begins personalizing the responses. The results are both humorous and moving, as Joanna, while using the great writer’s voice, begins to discover her own."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4960279/","name":"Margaret Qualley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3150488/","name":"Douglas Booth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0265852/","name":"Philippe Falardeau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0089507/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044330/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0265852/","name":"Philippe Falardeau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5117507/","name":"Joanna Smith Rakoff"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

D. Salinger. Fluctuating between poverty and glamour, she spends her days in a plush, wood-paneled office – where dictaphones and typewriters still reign and agents doze off after three-martini lunches – and her nights in a sink-less Brooklyn apartment with her socialist boyfriend. Joanna’s main task is processing Salinger’s voluminous fan mail, but as she reads the heart-wrenching letters from around the world, she becomes reluctant to send the agency’s impersonal standard letter and impulsively begins personalizing the responses. The results are both humorous and moving, as Joanna, while using the great writer’s voice, begins to discover her own.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4960279/","name":"Margaret Qualley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3150488/","name":"Douglas Booth"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0265852/","name":"Philippe Falardeau"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0089507/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044330/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0265852/","name":"Philippe Falardeau","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5117507/","name":"Joanna Smith Rakoff"],"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: One of a Kind Love
Jedyna taka miłość
One of a Kind Love
programme.desc:
One of a Kind Love: Directed by Philippe Lupien. With Jocelyn Hudon, Jake Manley, Daniela Sandiford, Raphael Grosz-Harvey. Kyra's dreams of being a jeweler have been put on the backburner, as her demanding job at the Sawyer Country Club is her priority. When a vacant shop becomes available in town, Kyra sees an opportunity to put a plan into action, until she learns that there's another renter interested in the space. Enter Aiden Sawyer, prodigal son, big-city business magnate and Kyra's childhood nemesis, returning home to the country club his parents own. As they patch up their past, Kyra and Aiden learn that there may be something more between them than just playful flirting. But when Kyra enters a renowned jewelry contest to raise enough money to outbid the mystery renter, Aiden finds himself in a race against time to make everything right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13012364/","name":"One of a Kind Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGY4MWQwNTEtOTEzMC00NDdjLWIwMTItMzcyZDhiMWNiM2JmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Kyra's dreams of being a jeweler have been put on the backburner, as her demanding job at the Sawyer Country Club is her priority. You can understand from the first moment Kyra and Eidan will have their happy ending, with the usual misunderstanding near the end of the movie but.... has a nice twist.... instead the usual format where this keeps going on and on..... The only thing i didn't like was the jewelry!!! Amid this dystopian landscape, a fearless courier, Nico (KJ Apa), who's immune to the deadly pathogen, finds hope and love with Sara (Sofia Carson), though her lockdown prohibits them from physical contact. programme.title: You Should Have Left
Powinniście odejść
You Should Have Left
programme.desc:
You Should Have Left: Directed by David Koepp. With Kevin Bacon, Amanda Seyfried, Avery Tiiu Essex, Colin Blumenau. A former banker, his actress wife, and their spirited daughter book a vacation at an isolated modern home in the Welsh countryside where nothing is quite as it seems." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8201852/","name":"You Should Have Left","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTMxMTJhNWQtYzQwMC00MThhLTkzNjMtMDljMGE1MmE1NWM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODkxMzcxOTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A former banker, his actress wife, and their spirited daughter book a vacation at an isolated modern home in the Welsh countryside where nothing is quite as it seems.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8201852/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gabrose5"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A decent psychological thriller","reviewBody":"The acting was meh, the writing was meh, but I loved loved loved the camera work. Straight lines/angles on screen and focused reflections and stark depth of field stuff, all relating to the movies story now that I think back on it. Simple yet impressive light effects.

I loved Stir of Echoes so I wanted to give this one a try, and this one kind of emulates that same "what's actually going on here?" theme that most psychological thriller's seem to have. While this movie didn't have great story pacing as Stir of Echoes did, it still held my attention fairly well. It got a bit confusing late in the 3rd act but the very ending cleared it up enough. Confusing to the point of almost hating the movie lol! But the last few lines worked well and made me go, "Ohhhhhh, that's what it meant..." so it wasn't as bad as it could've been.

ALSO - Those are some major red flags for an AirBnB when multiple townsfolk are raising their eyebrows at you staying there, right?!

I'd recommend it if you liked Stir of Echoes and enjoy Kevin Bacon, and if you like good camera work. Honestly the cinematography saved it for me.

6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18753,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-18","keywords":"nightmare,spatial loop,drowning,husband wife relationship,father daughter relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi238927385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4ODE4ZjEtYjJmNS00YjU3LWFkMzgtN2QyY2M3NDgyMGY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4ODE4ZjEtYjJmNS00YjU3LWFkMzgtN2QyY2M3NDgyMGY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theo Conroy is a successful middle-aged man whose marriage to his actress wife, Susanna, is shredding at the seams, frayed by her secretiveness, his jealousy, and the shadow of his past. 

In an effort to repair their relationship, Theo and Susanna book a vacation at a stunning, remote modern home in the Welsh countryside for themselves and their six-year-old daughter, Ella. What at first seems like a perfect retreat distorts into a perfect nightmare when Theo's grasp on reality begins to unravel and he suspects that a sinister force within the house knows more than he or Susanna have revealed, even to each other."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000102/","name":"Kevin Bacon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1086543/","name":"Amanda Seyfried"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10424479/","name":"Avery Tiiu Essex"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462895/","name":"David Koepp"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0098315/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462895/","name":"David Koepp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2479406/","name":"Daniel Kehlmann"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Pianist
Pianista
The Pianist
programme.desc:
The Pianist: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard. A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253474/","name":"The Pianist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRiZDIxZjktMTA1NC00MDQ2LWEzMjUtMTliZmY3NjQ3ODJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FilmOtaku"},"dateCreated":"2003-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"An astonishing film","reviewBody":"The Pianist is the true story of Wladyslaw Szpilman, at the time Poland's most acclaimed pianist whose life is transformed during the Nazi occupation of Warsaw beginning in 1939. The film spans several years and maps his many personal trials in addition to providing the perspectives of his family, rebel factions and sympathizers.

Brilliantly directed by Roman Polanski and starring an amazing Adrien Brody, The Pianist is bound to garner comparisons to Schindler's List, for obvious reasons. However similar the subject matter, the approach is different. While Schindler's List was filmed in a beautiful, crisp black and white that offered many incredible images, The Pianist was filmed with almost muted color. Schindler's List featured what has been argued as a complicated hero. Oskar Schindler did save many Jews, but not without battling his own materialistic demons first. The Pianist's Szpilman is a sympathetic character throughout. His plight was desperate, and the demons he fought were over his own guilt in surviving a fight that eventually turns into a primal will to live.

Polanski does not spare the viewer any grief with his film. The horrific scenes between the Nazis and the Warsaw Jews were more terrifying and horrible than any horror/suspense movie I have seen in some time, possibly ever. The humiliation and complete loss is wrenching. In several scenes, Jews are lined up in the middle of the night and subjected to either torture or death. In one case, a woman asks of a Nazi officer, "What will happen to us?" and is promptly shot point blank in the head. The camera does not flinch or subdue any of these atrocities.

A mention must be made of Brody's performance. Having only previously seen Brody in two other films, Spike Lee's "Summer of Sam" and Terrence Malick's "The Thin Red Line" (a part that was supposed to be his launch into stardom before his part was unfortunately cut drastically) I knew his potential was great. After his Oscar win, I viewed this movie with more criticism than I normally would have and he certainly did not disappoint. He transcended my expectations. His physical transformation was amazing, but more importantly, he conveyed the sorrow of this man shockingly well - in both verbal and non-verbal contexts. It will be very interesting to see what kind of opportunities this role will afford him, and the kinds of roles he will accept.

Something worth mentioning is the affect this movie had on the audience with whom I viewed this film. Normally, when a film ends, the regular hardcore filmsters like myself will stay and watch the credits in their entirety. The rest of the audience stands up and leaves, usually to the chagrin of the remaining enthusiasts. This was one of the few times I have seen a film at a theater where not one person stood to leave during the final credits. It wasn't until the house lights came up at the end did people begin to disperse. Personally, I hightailed it out of the theater the second the lights came on because not only was my face a mess from crying during the film (Tammy Faye comes to mind) but I had this overwhelming need for an emotional release, so when I reached my car I sat and wept for about five minutes. It has been years since I have watched a film that upset me to that extent. Conversely, while discussing this film with my brother, (someone who loves movies as much and has similar tastes as I do) he mentioned that while he thought the movie was excellent, he wasn't as profoundly emotionally effected as I was. After thinking about this for a couple of days, I realized the difference: The music. As a classical music enthusiast and erstwhile musician, the thought of not being able to enjoy, much less play the music you love is a tragic one. Then the emotional outpouring that comes when you return to it - there aren't words to describe how intense that is. Not having the same appreciation for this musical genre, one will be able to sympathize with the physical and emotional tribulations, but perhaps not in the musical sense.

The Pianist was truly an astonishing film. I was riveted from start to finish and so emotionally affected that I couldn't even consider writing a review until a week later. Having said that, I am filing this away with my list of movies which include Schindlers List and Philadelphia, as films that I love but cannot rewatch for a long time after due to their intensely emotional content.

--Shelly","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":773505,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Biography","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"pianist,holocaust,survival,nazi occupied poland,person in a wheelchair falls from height","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pianist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi988938521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004778/","name":"Adrien Brody"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470981/","name":"Thomas Kretschmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277975/","name":"Frank Finlay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024473/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844262/","name":"Wladyslaw Szpilman"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: One Fine Day
Szczęśliwy dzień
One Fine Day
programme.desc:
One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. IMDb data; ttnr: 0117247, Title: One Fine Day, --- Description: One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies","dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. It makes a pleasant and wholesome change from the usual fare of adolescent dreams.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-12-20","keywords":"architect,united states,usa,mother son relationship,friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"One Fine Day","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3298689305","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926165/","name":"Mae Whitman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001355/","name":"Michael Hoffman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002149/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0195234/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0783559/","name":"Terrel Seltzer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800124/","name":"Ellen Simon"],"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Seasoned with Love
Seasoned with Love
programme.desc:
Seasoned with Love: Directed by Claude Desrosiers. With Julia Benson, Peter Benson, Tori Barban, Kolton Stewart. Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives. Unfortunately, her car breaks down near New Holland, a small, quirky town where Winona rents a room at a local inn run by Adam, a widower. With the local Spring Festival coming up and the resident cook unavailable to manage the menu, Winona agrees to get her car fixed in time for her audition in exchange for her much needed help in the Inn's kitchen. As she prepares for the festival with Adam, Winona begins to fall in love with New Holland and one of its residents as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13013696/","name":"Seasoned with Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzcyOWRiZGQtMzk2Ni00ODRjLWJiZTAtOGQxZGNhNTU4NDJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13013696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkoch-98114"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"The ingredients of an enjoyable movie","reviewBody":"For a memorable feast you need a selection of fresh ingredients, a simple to follow recipe and a pot of imagination and good fortune. This film has those items sprinkled throughout. For men like me it's reassuring to have an average looking man win the heart of a gorgeously vivacious woman, even after finding out in real life they've been married more than 10 years. And also for married men it's encouraging to see that a woman is willing to fall in love with that man again after that much time has passed. I became so involved with the passage of this romance I fretted over the director dropping the ball in the final minutes, only to be surprised by one of the most convincing and satisfying endings I've seen.

Those actors that supported the main story also supplied a warmth that left an after taste that was richly enjoyable. My mother told me to never criticise other peoples' cooking, but I so enjoyed the film that those little thoughts didn't come to anything. It's not a complicated story, but importantly it's an interesting story, like a favourite meal I can see myself sitting down to enjoy again and again.

I've done a small number of reviews for films that surprised and unexpectedly delighted me, such that I hope you may feel the same. A realistic 7.5 score feels understated but heartfelt.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":146,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-04-30","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1365460/","name":"Julia Benson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1193045/","name":"Peter Benson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3379570/","name":"Tori Barban"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1068982/","name":"Claude Desrosiers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0228741/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5949587/","name":"Gemma Holdway"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Diablada: Directed by Álvaro Muñoz. With Daniel Candia, Cristián Chaparro, Karin Mayorinca, Ernesto Meléndez. A group of girls from a little town in the desert, disappears systematically without the police or the authorities taking action on the matter. Families seek help, but are faced with bureaucracy, discrimination and total abandonment." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt14237412/","name":"Diablada","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk5Y2VlZmMtOTY0NC00MzJhLWJkYjctNGY4ODA0YmQ4NDE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUxNjk0ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of girls from a little town in the desert, disappears systematically without the police or the authorities taking action on the matter. Families seek help, but are faced with bureaucracy, discrimination and total abandonment.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt14237412/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"karolfancinema"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Distorting and taking advantage of a real tragedy, which affects the families of the real victims.","reviewBody":"Unfortunately, this film was made without the consent and rights of the real mothers of the victims. This film tells a real dramatic event, which even today opens wounds and consequences in the families of the victims, poor families that have not yet received real reparation from the state of Chile. Organizations for the protection of women in Chile are condemning this production that profits from this tragedy and is once again re-victimizing the case and affecting even more the families of the girls and women who suffered this real tragedy. That's horrible! This should have been a serious documentary of reparation for the victims and not a commercial product that also distorts reality.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-03-14","keywords":"northern chile,one word title,serial killer","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4461567/","name":"Daniel Candia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1275107/","name":"Cristián Chaparro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12434889/","name":"Karin Mayorinca"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7100327/","name":"Álvaro Muñoz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0583592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1146177/","name":"Omar Saavedra Santis"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="
