Even though the first Bond film I ever saw was "For Your Eyes Only" with Roger Moore. I was very young and very much drawn in. I have seen every one of the Bond films and without a doubt, "Goldfinger" is the finest the 007 saga has to offer.

Before I had begun an appreciation of the Connery films, i.e. before I'd seen them, a good friend and cartooning mentor, Ross Paperman, sorted me out. He helped me see how Connery's Bond was suave and sophisticated but also demonstrated a quality the other Bonds do not portray: fear. Not a panicky soil-your-pants kind of fear, mind you. But Connery's Bond actually has a few anxious, sweat-soaked-brow moments. A perfect example is when Bond is strapped to a table as Goldfinger's captive with a laser beam primed to cut him in half. 007 has to think fast. "Do you expect me to talk?" "No, Mr. Bond, I expect you to die!" A famous scene and line from Bond's most enjoyable film.

Perhaps what makes the earlier films more enjoyable is that they had fresh, innovative elements that have now become cliché and gimmicky. The new films are often stale and already covered ground and they don't even appear to be trying anymore.

But it's more than that. Even watching "Goldfinger" today, having seen all the latest in special effects and technology that Hollywood has to offer, it still is riveting and thoroughly entertaining. That is also without the added advantage of being overly nostalgic about "Goldfinger". How could I? I hadn't even been born when it first hit theaters, and it was far from my first 007 experience. The story, the characters and the fun of "Goldfinger" is timeless and if given a chance could probably rope in a whole new generation of fans. It just doesn't seem likely to happen.

Much of the satire from the Austin Powers films is directly derived from the Connery films, especially "Goldfinger" and "Dr. No", proving their lasting effect on popular culture. As well, John Barry's scores from the Connery films are finding their way into the ears of a new generation through pop music as snippets from his soundtracks are sampled by such artists as Robbie Williams, Mono and Curve, to name a few.

But if by some fluke you read this and you haven't seen "Goldfinger" yet, do yourself right and acquaint yourself with the real James Bond. You'll probably be hooked by the time you hear Shirley Bassey's voice in the famous opening theme.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":181545,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1964-09-20","keywords":"official james bond series,gold,aston martin,race against time,british secret service","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Goldfinger","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2383218457","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ4NDI5YTEtZGMzMS00ZmM3LWI0YzctYWQ5OWIzYjc3MGYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ4NDI5YTEtZGMzMS00ZmM3LWI0YzctYWQ5OWIzYjc3MGYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Goldfinger","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000125/","name":"Sean Connery","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002085/","name":"Gert Fröbe","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000303/","name":"Honor Blackman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357891/","name":"Guy Hamilton"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0214989/","name":"Paul Dehn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Operacja Piorun
Thunderball
programme.desc: Członkowie międzynarodowej organizacji przestępczej Spectra, której szefem jest Emilio Largo (Adolfo Celi), kradną z arsenałów NATO dwie bomby atomowe. Grożą ich użyciem, jeśli nie otrzymają 100 mln funtów. James Bond (Sean Connery) z pomocą kochanki Emilia, Dominique Derval zwaną Domino (Claudine Auger), znajduje kryjówkę przywódcy Spectry. Zostaje jednak uwięziony. Tymczasem Largo z bombami na pokładzie ogromnego jachtu wyrusza w kierunku Miami...

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
Wojna państwa Rose
The War of the Roses
programme.desc: Ghostbusters II: Directed by Ivan Reitman. With Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Sigourney Weaver, Harold Ramis. The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097428/","name":"Ghostbusters II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTk4MjE5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIwNjYxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097428/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Quinoa1984"},"dateCreated":"2000-10-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"This film shouldn't be panned","reviewBody":"I say that one line summary not in the meaning you should watch this film in widescreen, but in that this film isn't as bad as some people say. Sure it might not have the ultimate originality of the 1st (of course), but it is still entertaining, one of the best of 1989. This time, we see 5 years later where the Ghostbusters parted ways (Venkman to a Talk show, Spengler to a child psychologist and Stanz as a book store owner) but are put back together because of new activity in the paranormal that could end the world (courtesy of a painting named Vigo). Then, comedy ensues with great visual effects to match. Still pretty funny (the talk show scene with Chloe Webb is utterly hilarious), but maybe just a tad lesser than the first. A-","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":190914,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1989-06-16","keywords":"ghost,new york city,ghostbuster,baby,slime","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Ghostbusters II","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2401943065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxOTJiOWEtZDY3Yi00MTMzLTk2NWItOWUxNGU4MzJmNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxOTJiOWEtZDY3Yi00MTMzLTk2NWItOWUxNGU4MzJmNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer 2"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718645/","name":"Ivan Reitman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000601/","name":"Harold Ramis"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

Qu'un sang impur...: Directed by Abdel Raouf Dafri. With Johan Heldenbergh, Linh Dan Pham, Lyna Khoudri, Steve Tientcheu. While he is only the shadow of the warrior he was in Indochina, Colonel Paul Andreas Breitner is forced to cross a Algeria at war, in search of his former senior officer: Colonel Simon Delignières, missing in the Aurès Nemencha, a real powder keg in the hands of the rebels." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9348690/","name":"Qu'un sang impur...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmJhMTI0YWYtMzVjYi00ZjRiLTk1MTAtY2U5ZTRlYjA0NTFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTIwMzA0NTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"While he is only the shadow of the warrior he was in Indochina, Colonel Paul Andreas Breitner is forced to cross a Algeria at war, in search of his former senior officer: Colonel Simon Delignières, missing in the Aurès Nemencha, a re","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9348690/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"saurabhyadav13"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Film. Historical and Gripping","reviewBody":"I think this movie is easily one of all-time Top 10 War films, and I'm not French or Algerian.

Nothing is predictable or black and white here, so realistic and gritty, the locations and actors are very authentic.

The characters pull you into their lives and the dialogue shines through even as subtitles. There are no winners in a war and the films shows it very well, makes you want to find out more about what happened in Algeria in 1960.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":319,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2020-01-22","keywords":"french algerian war,algerian war,sniper,torture,renegade commander","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce Teaser [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3241525017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjBiZDBiMWUtZDhjMS00ZTA5LWFjOWItMTQyYzMwYmM4NTgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjBiZDBiMWUtZDhjMS00ZTA5LWFjOWItMTQyYzMwYmM4NTgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0374949/","name":"Johan Heldenbergh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0199006/","name":"Linh Dan Pham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6891947/","name":"Lyna Khoudri"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2022382/","name":"Abdel Raouf Dafri"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0593456/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0729612/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2022382/","name":"Abdel Raouf Dafri"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Baghdad in My Shadow
programme.desc: Baghdad in My Shadow: Directed by Samir. With Haitham Abdel-Razzaq, Zahraa Ghandour, Waseem Abbas, Maxim Mehmet. "Abu Nawas" is a trendy café and popular hangout for artists, communists and gay Iraqi exiles in London, it's close to the Salafist Mosque. When Nasseer, a fanatic religious youth and nephew of poet Taufiq, attacks his uncle's friends he sets into action a course of events that will turn everyone's life upside down." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6864088/","name":"Baghdad in My Shadow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmY5ODFkM2MtN2U2NC00MzNkLWJkNjEtNTdkODE4NDUzYmYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTkyOTA4MjM@._V1_.jpg","description":""Abu Nawas" is a trendy café and popular hangout for artists, communists and gay Iraqi exiles in London, it's close to the Salafist Mosque. programme.title: Burn
Nasze dzieci
Barn
programme.desc: Burn: Directed by Mike Gan. With Tilda Cobham-Hervey, Josh Hutcherson, Suki Waterhouse, Harry Shum Jr.. When a gas station is held at gunpoint by a desperate man in need of cash, a lonely and unstable gas station attendant, tired of being overshadowed by her more outgoing co-worker, finds an opportunity to make a connection with the robber." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8009314/","name":"Burn","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ5Y2MxMTUtZGRiYy00YjAxLWEzNjEtM2I2Y2EzMDI0YjA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a gas station is held at gunpoint by a desperate man in need of cash, a lonely and unstable gas station attendant, tired of being overshadowed by her more outgoing co-worker, finds an opportunity to make a connection with the ro","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8009314/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ramspace1"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crazy people make for good thrillers.","reviewBody":"Just imagine that your are a night petrol pump shop attendant and a robber comes along. The robber points a gun at you, asks for the cash, you give the money, the robber runs away, and finally you call the cops. This real life situation would make for a very dull movie. But with Burn, that is not the case. There is just too much crazy thinking, too many uncalled for words in the dialogues. So it all leads to a lot of trouble. The lucky ones are the quiet ones. I saw it with a group of friends and our cheap comments were flying fast and furious. programme.title: Werk ohne Autor
Obrazy bez autora
Werk ohne Autor
programme.desc: Werk ohne Autor: Directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. With Tom Schilling, Sebastian Koch, Paula Beer, Saskia Rosendahl. German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5311542/","name":"Werk ohne Autor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUwYTQxZDYtYTZlMy00YmVhLTkyOTYtOTUwMzI2NTBlOWNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM2NTg3Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5311542/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jamesjustice-92"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"That's what true art looks like","reviewBody":"Ich spreche Deutsch ziemlich gut um zu kommunizieren aber nicht genug um die ganze Kritik auf Deutsch zu schreiben darum I'll write it in English. The new movie by Florian von Donnersmarck mesmerized me from the very beginning - the way he can capture the atmosphere, the way he portrays a main hero and even every little character is outstanding and you can literally never look away while watching this modern masterpiece. I actually don't understand why some movie titles are translated into other languages with their own meanings because "Never look away" does not fully capture the true meaning of it while "Work without author" does that almost perfectly. The author of another great one ("The lives of others", 2006) has not outdone himself but came pretty close to doing so: a movie that's so versatile, so multidimensional that you just can't fully figure it out on watch one - it needs to be watched many times. A story of a young boy growing up, facing difficulties, experiencing life changing moments, disappointments, reevaluations in search of an answer to the eternal question: who am I in this fast-changing world? - does it ever get old? I don't think so.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-10-03","keywords":"east germany,painter,doctor,forced abortion,pregnancy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1224587801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Never Look Away' follows thirty years in the life of artist Kurt Barnert (a character loosely based on Gerhard Richter). From a childhood witnessing Nazi Germany to life in post-war East Berlin."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462407/","name":"Sebastian Koch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3559009/","name":"Paula Beer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0569143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0128215/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"duration":"PT3H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Burn: Directed by Mike Gan. With Tilda Cobham-Hervey, Josh Hutcherson, Suki Waterhouse, Harry Shum Jr.. When a gas station is held at gunpoint by a desperate man in need of cash, a lonely and unstable gas station attendant, tired of being overshadowed by her more outgoing co-worker, finds an opportunity to make a connection with the robber." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8009314/","name":"Burn","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ5Y2MxMTUtZGRiYy00YjAxLWEzNjEtM2I2Y2EzMDI0YjA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a gas station is held at gunpoint by a desperate man in need of cash, a lonely and unstable gas station attendant, tired of being overshadowed by her more outgoing co-worker, finds an opportunity to make a connection with the ro","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8009314/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ramspace1"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crazy people make for good thrillers.","reviewBody":"Just imagine that your are a night petrol pump shop attendant and a robber comes along. The robber points a gun at you, asks for the cash, you give the money, the robber runs away, and finally you call the cops. This real life situation would make for a very dull movie. But with Burn, that is not the case. There is just too much crazy thinking, too many uncalled for words in the dialogues. So it all leads to a lot of trouble. The lucky ones are the quiet ones. I saw it with a group of friends and our cheap comments were flying fast and furious. programme.title: Watch List
Lista
Watch List
programme.desc: Watch List: Directed by Ben Rekhi. With Arthur Acuña, Bernard Carritero, Alessandra de Rossi, Jake Macapagal. After her husband is mysteriously killed in the drug wars of the Philippines, a widowed mother of three must confront her own darkness to protect her children from further harm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8512120/","name":"Watch List","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjRhMzUyNzEtOGUzNC00MDFmLThjMmItNmJiNWIyZmU4MWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE2MjUwNTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"After her husband is mysteriously killed in the drug wars of the Philippines, a widowed mother of three must confront her own darkness to protect her children from further harm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8512120/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alain-kapel5"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Solid thriller","reviewBody":"Watch List is a solid crime thriller from the Philippines. It's lean and mean, a bit melodramatic in a few scenes, but also tough to stomach for its cruel depiction of corruption and murderous police units. Viewers follow a woman who loses her husband after he gets shot by unknown assailants. This prompts her to try and look for his murderers, and her search leads her to a police inspector who promises they will be found if she agrees to work for him as an informant. However, she soon realizes this also includes being part of a hit squad... the plot moves forward with no stop gaps after this point. It's a straightforward film that dabbles in complicated real life issues revolving around the Philippines' uncompromising police operations. Drug users and dealers are taken out with little thought given to their current affairs. If they're on the ominous drug watch list, it's uncertain how long they have left before a hit squad comes for them. Acting is convincing and cinematography vivid and gritty, especially in nighttime scenes, further amplifying the film's tense and morally grey narrative. Some of the more apparent flaws here include a feeling of predictability, as many events are easy to foresee, while the film also tends to state the obvious in some of the dialogues. This doesn't detract from the overall impression, though, that Watch List is a pretty good film that should appeal to most crime thriller fans.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":236,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-02-19","keywords":"children","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch List","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4117675545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU2Nzg4MGUtOTIyZi00NTEyLWI3NDYtMTA3NTEwOTU3NTM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU2Nzg4MGUtOTIyZi00NTEyLWI3NDYtMTA3NTEwOTU3NTM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010355/","name":"Arthur Acuña"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6041424/","name":"Bernard Carritero"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211278/","name":"Alessandra de Rossi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1266863/","name":"Ben Rekhi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0146372/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0799784/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1266863/","name":"Ben Rekhi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2891978/","name":"Rona Lean Sales"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La vérité
Instynkt
Instinct
programme.desc: La vérité: Directed by Hirokazu Koreeda. With Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche, Ethan Hawke, Clémentine Grenier. A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8323120/","name":"La vérité","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJjMTVhMzMtOTQwNC00MzVkLWE3YjMtMjkwYTQ0YzEyMjBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8323120/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xstal"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"'My memories, my book'...","reviewBody":"If you wrote your own book to tell your own story how close would your memories be to reality and how much would you conjure up, especially in relation to your relations and relationships. In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6793710/","name":"El crack cero","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTU1M2U4OWUtZTQ5OS00OWM1LTljN2EtMWJmZDgxNzUwZGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793710/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"r-95017"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty bad","reviewBody":"Filmed in black and white, the acting is pretty woeful, it's difficult to want to pay attention when you're constantly confronted with examples or poor editing. It's so bad at times it made me wonder if it's deliberate.

The script has dramatic style to it, adding to the abstract lack of warmth for the characters. I get that he is a PI but I hope nobody has ever needed to look into the distance so many times in 2 hours.

I think it's also generally inconsistent, revelling in what I imagine were seen as character development and setting the seen comes across as predictable. programme.desc: The Story of Racheltjie De Beer: Directed by Matthys Boshoff. With Sandra Prinsloo, Marius Weyers, Charlie Bouguenon, Antoinette Louw. South African wilderness 1800's. Five years after their mother's death, preadolescent Rachel and 5-year-old Jamie find themselves on their way to the virgin gold fields with their father Herman as he tries to start a new life. When Jamie goes missing in a freak blizzard, Rachel braves the snowstorm to search for her little brother in the 19th-century South-African wilderness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2188925/","name":"The Story of Racheltjie De Beer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTRjZTg1N2UtYzQ1My00ZGNhLWJkOTUtMDAzZGQ5MDQ5NjY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQzMTQwOTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"South African wilderness 1800's. IMDb data; ttnr: 2188925, Title: The Story of Racheltjie De Beer, --- Description: The Story of Racheltjie De Beer: Directed by Matthys Boshoff. With Sandra Prinsloo, Marius Weyers, Charlie Bouguenon, Antoinette Louw. South African wilderness 1800's. Five years after their mother's death, preadolescent Rachel and 5-year-old Jamie find themselves on their way to the virgin gold fields with their father Herman as he tries to start a new life. I think it's also generally inconsistent, revelling in what I imagine were seen as character development and setting the seen comes across as predictable. programme.title: Intemperie
Pod gołym niebem
Intemperie
programme.desc: Intemperie: Directed by Benito Zambrano. With Luis Tosar, Luis Callejo, Jaime López, Vicente Romero. In a tyrannical and oppressive Spain of misery and poorness, a child starts a runaway looking for freedom." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8406744/","name":"Intemperie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc5NmM3MWItZGJkZS00NGVlLThhMDctOTcwYTYyMGQzNWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDI3MDY3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a tyrannical and oppressive Spain of misery and poorness, a child starts a runaway looking for freedom.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8406744/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ok_english_bt"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hardly an original theme ... still a darn good (Spanish) western!","reviewBody":"Weren't a lot of the original 'spaghetti' westerns shot in Spain? You can see why from the rugged dusty landscapes of Andalucia Benito Zambrano uses in 'Intemperie'. Rather clumsily titled 'Out in the Open' in English, doesn't really capture the essence of this chase western, 'Runaway' or 'On The Run' would be better. Without wanting to repeat the information provided by other reviews which is excellent, just wanted to add my voice to those who enjoyed the film. The 3 leads are outstanding and worthy of note. What an actor Luis Tosar is, in this role playing the war veteran turned nomadic herdsman 'Moor', so much screen presence, but also Jaime López is compelling as the child runaway, and Luis Callejo chillingly psychotic in the role of the cruel landholder. Many other aspects of the film are admirable, I'll leave people to make up their own minds ... highly recommended!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1221,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Adventure","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-11-22","keywords":"kid,child,nameless character,shepherd,wasteland","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3323706393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0N2VlMjktNTNhYS00NTJjLWE5MTgtYjc5NmFkYzBjMzY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0N2VlMjktNTNhYS00NTJjLWE5MTgtYjc5NmFkYzBjMzY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869088/","name":"Luis Tosar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0130429/","name":"Luis Callejo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7235691/","name":"Jaime López"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0952583/","name":"Benito Zambrano"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048117/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071642/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0809116/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5488769/","name":"Jesús Carrasco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2515343/","name":"Daniel Remón"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1932665/","name":"Pablo Remón"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

A popular undergrad faking cancer struggles to maintain her secret." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9169036/","name":"White Lie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjRiNDFhYjgtNDk0Yi00YWNlLTk5YTQtODY4YTE5M2Q0YjRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzMwOTk0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A popular undergrad faking cancer struggles to maintain her secret.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9169036/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xstal"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cause & Effect...","reviewBody":"The best cinema always gets you thinking and if a film ever had the power to do that you've just found it. How you scale and share your empathy between cause and effect might reveal a lot about the way you perceive the world around you. On the one hand - she'll get what's coming to her, deceitful so and so and, on the other, what has happened to cause this young woman to behave this way. The Story of Racheltjie De Beer
programme.desc: The Story of Racheltjie De Beer: Directed by Matthys Boshoff. With Sandra Prinsloo, Marius Weyers, Charlie Bouguenon, Antoinette Louw. South African wilderness 1800's. Five years after their mother's death, preadolescent Rachel and 5-year-old Jamie find themselves on their way to the virgin gold fields with their father Herman as he tries to start a new life. A Million Little Pieces
programme.desc: A Million Little Pieces: Directed by Sam Taylor-Johnson. With Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Billy Bob Thornton, Odessa Young, Giovanni Ribisi. A drug dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for addicted." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0427543/","name":"A Million Little Pieces","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhhMTA3ODYtZGEzZC00MzgwLWEyYzktZjVkMDlkYmRjMTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drug dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for addicted.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0427543/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sort of gets there, in the end....","reviewBody":"As long as we remember that this is a work of fiction, then it isn't a bad little runner. Aaron Taylor-Johnson and an extremely dapper Billy Bob Thornton engender some interest in their characters and as such, you do find yourself starting to care for them. ATJ plays an out-of-control druggie with little, he thinks, to live for; is sent to a rehab centre and meets Lilly (Odessa Young). The film develops sensitively - if, at times, angrily - and does offer us a little considered insight into the worlds of the carers and the cared-for. Nothing you won't have seen (or, likely, read) before and it is maybe just a bit too long, but it does deserve a viewing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2499,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-06","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,title directed by female,shower,drugs,addiction","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Million Little Pieces","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3980442649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdhNGU1ZmMtMjVmNS00NjdmLWJkOTgtY2JkNzVkMDg4ZjY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdhNGU1ZmMtMjVmNS00NjdmLWJkOTgtY2JkNzVkMDg4ZjY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1093951/","name":"Aaron Taylor-Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3747611/","name":"Odessa Young"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0853374/","name":"Sam Taylor-Johnson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0554532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0583900/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1093951/","name":"Aaron Taylor-Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0853374/","name":"Sam Taylor-Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294580/","name":"James Frey"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: The Resident: Created by Amy Holden Jones, Hayley Schore, Roshan Sethi. With Matt Czuchry, Manish Dayal, Bruce Greenwood, Emily VanCamp. A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6483832/","name":"The Resident","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc1MmE1NGYtMzFlYS00YTNmLThjNmEtMjQ5NzY4NmJkZTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODkxMzcxOTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6483832/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bjapexnc"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a watch judge for yourself","reviewBody":"I actually like and hate the show at the same time. While I like the doctors and nurses I stay angry with the administrative side of things and those who are representing them. While some reviews here say how unrealistic the show is the most unrealistic part is the doctors who stand up to the bureaucrats. If you are a patient who has been turn down because you didn't have the money or insurance to pay for the needed medical attention you know it is closer to reality then those here want to admit. I say watch it and judge for yourself. If you can get past wanting to punch the head of surgery then you might just find that you like it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-01-21","keywords":"two word title,atlanta georgia,georgia,hospital,medical","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194516/","name":"Matt Czuchry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2110485/","name":"Manish Dayal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339304/","name":"Bruce Greenwood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152181/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070636/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0683032/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0427468/","name":"Amy Holden Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2735698/","name":"Hayley Schore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6149734/","name":"Roshan Sethi"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 1 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi528529689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2RjODYyNTMtZTljZC00ZmViLWEzZmYtZjExNmM2Y2I2MTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2RjODYyNTMtZTljZC00ZmViLWEzZmYtZjExNmM2Y2I2MTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":""The Resident" follows Dr. Conrad Hawkins, one of the best doctors at Chastain Park Memorial Hospital. programme.title: Enemy of the State
Wróg publiczny
Enemy of the State
programme.desc:
Enemy of the State: Directed by Tony Scott. With Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight, Lisa Bonet. A lawyer becomes targeted by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a politically motivated crime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120660/","name":"Enemy of the State","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI0Y2NhMzMtYTE5ZS00MDlhLTg0ZjEtMjAwZmEwNTc0ODc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lawyer becomes targeted by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a politically motivated crime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120660/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neilmac"},"dateCreated":"2003-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crackerjack Thriller with a message...","reviewBody":"Why? Well for starters there is the best chase sequence since The French Connection. Then there is Will Smith as an actor - not just a star, though later in the movie he is admittedly overshadowed by veteran Gene Hackman.

There are two layers to this movie: On the surface is a pacy thriller with edge-of-the-seat chases but underneath lies a telling commentary on government surveillance. It is one of those truth-in-fiction stories which makes its point about government intrusion into privacy dramatically and effectively.

There are references to the classic, The Conversation: The surveilled couple talking in the park, and the Hackman character's premises are an obvious recreation of his workshop in the earlier movie. If you haven't yet seen The Conversation - see it before you see this one - you will understand the Hackman character a lot better (besides, it is a superb movie in its own right).

Oh, and Jon Voight is terrific as the bad guy...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":235012,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1999-02-24","keywords":"on the run,conspiracy,nsa,surveillance,national security agency","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Enemy of the State","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi384368921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlmZjZmZTAtOGE4My00ZWFkLTlmMmQtMTM5NTFhNTNkMTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlmZjZmZTAtOGE4My00ZWFkLTlmMmQtMTM5NTFhNTNkMTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Buena Vista Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000685/","name":"Jon Voight"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001716/","name":"Tony Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026281/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102770/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Edge of Tomorrow
Na skraju jutra
Edge of Tomorrow
programme.desc:
Edge of Tomorrow: Directed by Doug Liman. With Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt, Brendan Gleeson, Bill Paxton. A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1631867/","name":"Edge of Tomorrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5OTk4MTM3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODcxNjg3MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1631867/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lornloxor"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Witty and thrilling summer blockbuster with Tom Cruise in top form","reviewBody":"You could describe this movie as a dizzying combination of Groundhog Day, Starship Troopers, Source Code and The Butterfly Effect. Edge of Tomorrow borrows from these films and while some of the individual ideas may not therefore be groundbreakingly original, the way they're combined and put to use in Edge of Tomorrow by director Doug Liman certainly is. As aliens have invaded Earth, humanity's only hope lies in a cowardly PR officer Bill Cage (played by Tom Cruise) with no combat skills who is sent to the front lines. His only advantage? A save point, sort of. Are you excited yet? You should be. I don't want to tell you more specifics about the plot because it's best to experience and discover this great piece of work yourself. 

You have to love Tom Cruise as an actor, he always gives his roles a 100 percent and he's phenomenal in Edge of Tomorrow - Physical, funny and determined. I'd say this is his best performance since Collateral. Emily Blunt is fantastically badass as the poster girl of the war, Rita Vrataski. This is her first real action film and she knocks it out of the park. Cruise and Blunt also have great chemistry together. Bill Paxton and Brandon Gleeson give great supporting performances and most of the supporting soldiers have distinct personalities even with their limited screen times. 

Edge of Tomorrow's world building is slick and credible. The CGI and the special effects are seamless and bring the great set pieces and the relentless aliens to life. The action is really exhilarating (the cool exoskeleton suits definitely help here) and the script is very witty and inventive as it needs to be when you're dealing with time travel (or time resets if you will). Despite its action thrills Edge of Tomorrow finds plenty of room for character development both for Cruise and Blunt. The script also manages to pull off some quite funny scenes (especially in the training segment). I also have to mention James Herbert's snappy editing because it's that good. The the situations could get old really fast if it wasn't for the fast-paced editing that concisely and freshly shows the differences in each repetition Cruise goes through. The pacing is absolutely relentless and there isn't a boring moment in the film. 

The tone of the film is pretty much perfect for a summer blockbuster. It's not overly morose or gloomy despite the backdrop of an alien invasion. Instead it opts for wit, fun and action thrills. I was really gripped from start to finish and I had this big grin on my face when I left the theater. I really liked the other recent blockbusters in Godzilla and X-Men: Days of Future Past but Edge of Tomorrow surpasses them both. If only every summer blockbuster was such good fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":633454,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2014-06-04","keywords":"time loop,alien,alien invasion,dying repeatedly,combat","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"IMAX Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3591679257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0Mjk4MTI0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQyNjE4MTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0Mjk4MTI0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQyNjE4MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A soldier fighting in a war with aliens finds himself caught in a time loop of his last day in the battle, though he becomes better skilled along the way.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1289434/","name":"Emily Blunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000200/","name":"Bill Paxton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0449458/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003160/","name":"Christopher McQuarrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125336/","name":"Jez Butterworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3890871/","name":"John-Henry Butterworth"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
Szybcy i wściekli: Tokio Drift
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
programme.desc:
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift: Directed by Justin Lin. With Lucas Black, Damien Marzette, Trula M. Marcus, Zachery Ty Bryan. A teenager becomes a major competitor in the world of drift racing after moving in with his father in Tokyo to avoid a jail sentence in America." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0463985/","name":"The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTMxODEyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDgxMjA0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager becomes a major competitor in the world of drift racing after moving in with his father in Tokyo to avoid a jail sentence in America.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0463985/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaCocoa"},"dateCreated":"2017-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"No rats in buckets, no CGI, just an entertaining flick featuring excellent car racing","reviewBody":"Branching away from any original cast members of the first two films, thankfully, Tokyo Drift provides a refreshingly new look to the franchise.

Tokyo Drift is possibly my favourite of the series, or at least its up there with the first film; it only has a few problems that can be swept under the "It's Fast and the Furious, what do you expect" carpet. The story follows American "teenager" Sean Boswell (Lucas Black) whose reckless driving lands him prison time, but to avoid this he moves in with his father in Tokyo. He attempts to move on a dangerous rival's girl, and must become a competitor in the street racing's drifting scene.

I say "teenager" as that's what IMDb says, and he does go to school in the movie but honestly, he's the oldest teen I've ever seen. Along with every other "teen" in this movie! While I talk negatives, the majority of the film is set in Tokyo yet 95% of the dialogue is English and Sean has a knack of meeting every foreigner in the city. I don't mind this so much, but I fully expect all of the Japanese characters to speak Japanese, especially when Sean isn't present!

But, unlike 2 Fast 2 Furious (choke) this film actually cares for its characters and their personalities (as Sean says early on: "It's not about the ride, it's about the rider") from Sean's fish-out-of- water acceptance, to his mentor Han's closet of skeletons. The villain isn't ridiculous either, his uncle is part of the Yakuza and he has a serious "king of a little hill" problem. Again unlike 2 Fast 2 Furious (gag) the cars have never looked better, sleek and refined and the drifting action is spectacular, especially when synchronized. Plus, no CGI, just skilled professional drivers, making the film worth seeing solely for the racing.

There's no stupid Tyrese Gibson mugging at the camera, no rats in buckets, no CGI, just an entertaining (albeit poorly localized) flick featuring excellent car racing and professional stunts.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":258134,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-08-23","keywords":"yakuza,chase,showdown,dominic toretto character,han seoul oh character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Everything We Know About 'F9'","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2943402009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk5ODI0YjUtN2VkYy00YTgyLTg5NGQtYmE1MzQ4MTVhOTA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk5ODI0YjUtN2VkYy00YTgyLTg5NGQtYmE1MzQ4MTVhOTA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this IMDbrief we put the pedal to the metal on the Fast Saga and everything you need to know about 'F9' (2021)."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085407/","name":"Lucas Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117022/","name":"Zachery Ty Bryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510168/","name":"Shad Moss"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510912/","name":"Justin Lin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604555/","name":"Chris Morgan"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0463985, Title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift, --- Description: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift: Directed by Justin Lin. With Lucas Black, Damien Marzette, Trula M. Marcus, Zachery Ty Bryan. A teenager becomes a major competitor in the world of drift racing after moving in with his father in Tokyo to avoid a jail sentence in America." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0463985/","name":"The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTMxODEyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDgxMjA0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager becomes a major competitor in the world of drift racing after moving in with his father in Tokyo to avoid a jail sentence in America.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0463985/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaCocoa","dateCreated":"2017-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"No rats in buckets, no CGI, just an entertaining flick featuring excellent car racing","reviewBody":"Branching away from any original cast members of the first two films, thankfully, Tokyo Drift provides a refreshingly new look to the franchise.

Tokyo Drift is possibly my favourite of the series, or at least its up there with the first film; it only has a few problems that can be swept under the "It's Fast and the Furious, what do you expect" carpet. The story follows American "teenager" Sean Boswell (Lucas Black) whose reckless driving lands him prison time, but to avoid this he moves in with his father in Tokyo. He attempts to move on a dangerous rival's girl, and must become a competitor in the street racing's drifting scene.

I say "teenager" as that's what IMDb says, and he does go to school in the movie but honestly, he's the oldest teen I've ever seen. Along with every other "teen" in this movie! While I talk negatives, the majority of the film is set in Tokyo yet 95% of the dialogue is English and Sean has a knack of meeting every foreigner in the city. I don't mind this so much, but I fully expect all of the Japanese characters to speak Japanese, especially when Sean isn't present!

But, unlike 2 Fast 2 Furious (choke) this film actually cares for its characters and their personalities (as Sean says early on: "It's not about the ride, it's about the rider") from Sean's fish-out-of- water acceptance, to his mentor Han's closet of skeletons. The villain isn't ridiculous either, his uncle is part of the Yakuza and he has a serious "king of a little hill" problem. Again unlike 2 Fast 2 Furious (gag) the cars have never looked better, sleek and refined and the drifting action is spectacular, especially when synchronized. Plus, no CGI, just skilled professional drivers, making the film worth seeing solely for the racing.

There's no stupid Tyrese Gibson mugging at the camera, no rats in buckets, no CGI, just an entertaining (albeit poorly localized) flick featuring excellent car racing and professional stunts.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":258134,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-08-23","keywords":"yakuza,chase,showdown,dominic toretto character,han seoul oh character","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Everything We Know About 'F9'","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2943402009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk5ODI0YjUtN2VkYy00YTgyLTg5NGQtYmE1MzQ4MTVhOTA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk5ODI0YjUtN2VkYy00YTgyLTg5NGQtYmE1MzQ4MTVhOTA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this IMDbrief we put the pedal to the metal on the Fast Saga and everything you need to know about 'F9' (2021).","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085407/","name":"Lucas Black","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117022/","name":"Zachery Ty Bryan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510168/","name":"Shad Moss"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510912/","name":"Justin Lin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604555/","name":"Chris Morgan"],"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Frankie Go Boom
3, 2, 1... Frankie w sieci
Frankie Go Boom
programme.desc: Frankie Go Boom: Directed by Jordan Roberts. With Charlie Hunnam, Nora Dunn, Sam Anderson, Chris O'Dowd. Frank Bartlett has been tortured, embarrassed, and humiliated by his brother Bruce -- usually on film -- his entire life. Now that Bruce is finally off drugs and has turned his life around, things should be different. They are not." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1772271/","name":"Frankie Go Boom","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzE5MDlmODAtYzYwNS00ZDczLWE2YmUtNWVhOTg0YTVlNTBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODEwMTc2ODQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frank Bartlett has been tortured, embarrassed, and humiliated by his brother Bruce -- usually on film -- his entire life. Now that Bruce is finally off drugs and has turned his life around, things should be different. They are not.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1772271/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rory-339-54213"},"dateCreated":"2012-04-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"hilarious comedy","reviewBody":"Frankie does what great comedies do. The movie sets up a very 'unlikely' scenario through which the characters must find their way. The movie doesn't shy away from many, if any of the social issues of our day but Jordan Roberts has taken a very fresh approach and thus each scene has both real hilarity and real humanity. Not enough can be said of the cast. To a person they bring such good work. Stand outs are the lead Charlie Hunnam, and his love interest Lizze Caplan. Of course, both Chris Noth and Ron Perlman fill the screen with their scene stealing roles.\n\nWhile clearly working with a small, indie budget Roberts and his team have created a quality film with tremendous production values, that can easily compete with movies that cost much more to make.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4961,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-03-10","keywords":"jock strap,male objectification,bare chested male,masturbation reference,name in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3001918745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MDI1Njg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODU3MDMyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MDI1Njg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODU3MDMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frank Bartlett has been tortured, embarrassed, and humiliated by his brother Bruce -- usually on film -- his entire life. Now that Bruce is finally off drugs and has turned his life around, things should be different. They are not. programme.desc:
Bad Words: Directed by Jason Bateman. With Jason Bateman, Kathryn Hahn, Rohan Chand, Philip Baker Hall. A spelling bee loser sets out to exact revenge by finding a loophole and attempting to win as an adult." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2170299/","name":"Bad Words","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2M1MDljMmItMDE0ZS00OTQxLTkxNmQtMTgwZjk3NmM3MDc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A spelling bee loser sets out to exact revenge by finding a loophole and attempting to win as an adult.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2170299/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"leonfenwick"},"dateCreated":"2014-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great film. A different kind of "feel-good" movie.","reviewBody":"Other reviewers here have slated the film due to the language which I agree was a little harsh considering the age of the actors but the film would just not have worked without it. The characters were developed brilliantly all the way through and production perfect. 

Saying much more would be leaning towards spoilers which are as they suggest. I will say it is funny, heart-warming and generally enjoyable.

If I had one criticism it would only be that it was a tiny bit predictable but by the end of the movie I just didn't care.

Would recommend this movie to all except those unduly sensitive to language.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":48601,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-03-28","keywords":"spelling bee,forty something,high school dropout,spelling,two word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3718425369","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyOTc3MjgxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQzNzEwMTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyOTc3MjgxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQzNzEwMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"40-year-old Guy Trilby finds a loophole in the rules of the National Quill Spelling Bee and decides to cause trouble by hijacking the competition. Contest officials, outraged parents, and overly ambitious 8th graders are no match for Guy, as he ruthlessly crushes their dreams of victory and fame. As a reporter attempts to discover his true motivation, Guy finds himself forging an unlikely alliance with a competitor: awkward 10-year old Chaitanya, who is completely unfazed by GuyÂ’s take-no-prisoners approach to life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000867/","name":"Jason Bateman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1063517/","name":"Kathryn Hahn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005049/","name":"Allison Janney"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000867/","name":"Jason Bateman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0369082/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0437457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3775019/","name":"Andrew Dodge"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Laws of Attraction
Pozew o miłość
Laws of Attraction
programme.desc: Laws of Attraction: Directed by Peter Howitt. With Pierce Brosnan, Julianne Moore, Michael Sheen, Parker Posey. Amidst a sea of litigation, two New York City divorce lawyers find love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0323033/","name":"Laws of Attraction","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzODg4MjM1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzQzNTI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Amidst a sea of litigation, two New York City divorce lawyers find love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0323033/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chris_Docker"},"dateCreated":"2004-05-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Loads of talent do not a story make up for","reviewBody":"It's great to see Julianne Moore in a comedy role again, reminding us of the not inconsiderable range of her talents. Laws of Attraction is a rather well-worn comedy though that lacks sparkle. Two top divorce layers battle it out and eventually get romantic about each other. If the script sizzled it might be able to hold a candle, but it doesn't - which is a great shame given the great performances (Pierce Brosnan also does well, appearing far less wooden than in his James Bond roles). The whole film has a rather contrived feel to it that no amount of acting talent can salvage. Throwing in a bit of Irish countryside seems gratuitous in the extreme, a bit of cutesiness for the American box-office.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22874,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-09-29","keywords":"neo screwball comedy,workplace romance,coworker relationship,using others,love","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Laws of Attraction","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2744451353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNGRlNDQtNzljNS00ZGE5LWI5NWEtZjE0NGM3YTVmNDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNGRlNDQtNzljNS00ZGE5LWI5NWEtZjE0NGM3YTVmNDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000112/","name":"Pierce Brosnan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0398185/","name":"Peter Howitt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054516/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088199/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011877/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112459/","name":"Aline Brosh McKenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0363326/","name":"Robert Harling"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Confessions of a Shopaholic
Wyznania zakupoholiczki
Confessions of a Shopaholic
programme.desc:
Confessions of a Shopaholic: Directed by P.J. Hogan. With Isla Fisher, Hugh Dancy, Krysten Ritter, Joan Cusack. A college grad lands a job as a financial journalist in New York City to support where she nurtures her shopping addiction and falls for a wealthy entrepreneur." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1093908/","name":"Confessions of a Shopaholic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MzcyMTkwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDM3MTc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A college grad lands a job as a financial journalist in New York City to support where she nurtures her shopping addiction and falls for a wealthy entrepreneur.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1093908/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"daverolltide"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny and timely","reviewBody":""Confessions of a Shopaholic" is a chick flick romcom that you can take your daughter to see. You can take your mother to see it. Heck, you can take grandma. It's rated PG. No f-bombs. No naked people. No gun play.

Isla Fisher plays Rebecca Bloomfield, a journalist with an addiction to shopping. She gets into very deep debt. Kind of like our nation has done recently and is continuing to do. Not that this movie is intended to be any kind of political metaphor. It's just a cute and funny movie which any of us, male or female, can relate to---if we've ever accumulated too big a balance on our credit cards. (I know that I could've used a bailout a few times in my life!)

While the script provides some decent laughs, I loved Isla Fisher's physical comedy. She's good. 

Hugh Dancy as the male lead was okay. But I'll leave the critique of his work to a female poster.

Always fun to see actors and actresses who you like but haven't seen on screen that much lately and "Shopaholic" has a few. Like Julie "Airplane" Hagerty and Wendy "Just Shoot Me/Dream On" Malick. Kristin Scott-Thomas, John Lithgow and, yes, Lynn Redgrave. Not to mention Joan Cusack and John Goodman as Rebecca's mom and dad.

For me, this is way more entertaining than last week's chick flick (the one which I'm just not that into). Even though that one had more star power, this one is the better movie, I think.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":76424,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2009-03-18","keywords":"f rated,female journalist,magazine,debt,shopping","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Confessions of a Shopaholic: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4268949529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ1NTkyNzItODZlZS00ODVkLWIzMzgtOTQ0YTgxZDJjMWY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpybA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ1NTkyNzItODZlZS00ODVkLWIzMzgtOTQ0YTgxZDJjMWY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpybA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first trailer for Confessions of a Shopaholic, directed by P.J. Hogan and starring Isla Fisher."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0279545/","name":"Isla Fisher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0199215/","name":"Hugh Dancy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1269983/","name":"Krysten Ritter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026281/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414117/","name":"Tracey Jackson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0278759/","name":"Tim Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1547852/","name":"Kayla Alpert"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1093908, Title: Confessions of a Shopaholic, --- Description: Confessions of a Shopaholic: Directed by P.J. Hogan. With Isla Fisher, Hugh Dancy, Krysten Ritter, Joan Cusack. A college grad lands a job as a financial journalist in New York City to support where she nurtures her shopping addiction and falls for a wealthy entrepreneur." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1093908/","name":"Confessions of a Shopaholic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MzcyMTkwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDM3MTc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A college grad lands a job as a financial journalist in New York City to support where she nurtures her shopping addiction and falls for a wealthy entrepreneur.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1093908/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"daverolltide","dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny and timely","reviewBody":""Confessions of a Shopaholic" is a chick flick romcom that you can take your daughter to see. You can take your mother to see it. Heck, you can take grandma. It's rated PG. No f-bombs. No naked people. No gun play.

Isla Fisher plays Rebecca Bloomfield, a journalist with an addiction to shopping. She gets into very deep debt. Kind of like our nation has done recently and is continuing to do. Not that this movie is intended to be any kind of political metaphor. It's just a cute and funny movie which any of us, male or female, can relate to---if we've ever accumulated too big a balance on our credit cards. (I know that I could've used a bailout a few times in my life!)

While the script provides some decent laughs, I loved Isla Fisher's physical comedy. She's good. 

Hugh Dancy as the male lead was okay. But I'll leave the critique of his work to a female poster.

Always fun to see actors and actresses who you like but haven't seen on screen that much lately and "Shopaholic" has a few. Like Julie "Airplane" Hagerty and Wendy "Just Shoot Me/Dream On" Malick. Kristin Scott-Thomas, John Lithgow and, yes, Lynn Redgrave. Not to mention Joan Cusack and John Goodman as Rebecca's mom and dad.

For me, this is way more entertaining than last week's chick flick (the one which I'm just not that into). Even though that one had more star power, this one is the better movie, I think.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":76424,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2009-03-18","keywords":"f rated,female journalist,magazine,debt,shopping","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Confessions of a Shopaholic: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4268949529","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ1NTkyNzItODZlZS00ODVkLWIzMzgtOTQ0YTgxZDJjMWY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpybA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ1NTkyNzItODZlZS00ODVkLWIzMzgtOTQ0YTgxZDJjMWY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpybA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first trailer for Confessions of a Shopaholic, directed by P.J. If Your a Fan of the First Two You Won't Enjoy This,","reviewBody":"Big Mommas: Like Father,Like Son is a brutal movie with a stupid storyline that is mainly only trying to be funny,but even fails at that.I've seen the first two,which I didn't find brilliant,but there are plenty of funny scenes in them to make it somewhat enjoyable,and that is completely absent in this.The main thing that made the first two so enjoyable is Martin Lawrence,and he isn't in this as much,its more about his step son played by Brandon T Jackson,who I didn't enjoy,his fat suit wasn't as funny and his voice as a woman wasn't either,the scenes that Martin Lawrence is in is the only reason i'm not giving this a lower rating.Even if you are a big fan of the first two Big Mommas,I don't think you'll enjoy this,and definitely not if your looking for something funny to watch,I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone.\n\nAfter his stepson Trent (Brandon T Jackson) witnesses a murder,Malcolm (Martin Lawrence) and programme.title: About Time
Czas na miłość
About Time
programme.desc:
About Time: Directed by Richard Curtis. With Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams, Bill Nighy, Lydia Wilson. At the age of 21, Tim discovers he can travel in time and change what happens and has happened in his own life. His decision to make his world a better place by getting a girlfriend turns out not to be as easy as you might think." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2194499/","name":"About Time","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1ODUzMDA3NzFeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDgxMTYxNTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the age of 21, Tim discovers he can travel in time and change what happens and has happened in his own life. His decision to make his world a better place by getting a girlfriend turns out not to be as easy as you might think.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2194499/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cinematic_aficionado"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"an unexpected delight","reviewBody":"A young man, like many others. Only he can travel in time. This main element of the plot, is something that was difficult to digest throughout the film, since it was not a predominantly sci-fi movie. This struggle was compensated by the successful interjection that even with such ability, life can have difficulties.

The main character, did use this to his advantage to win the love of the girl he was so fond of but still he often faced difficult choices as to let things happen or turn the time back to prevent them.

One thing that makes this stand out is the somewhat philosophical approach, an approach that is conveyed with simplicity so all can relate.

Overall, it is an intelligent film, with emotion and poignancy."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":324480,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2013-09-04","keywords":"time travel,father son relationship,family relationships,wedding,marriage","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi802400281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM5MTAyNzgyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ4ODI1MDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM5MTAyNzgyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ4ODI1MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the age of 21, Tim discovers he can travel in time and change what happens and has happened in his own life. programme.title: Defendor
Defendor
programme.desc:
Defendor: Directed by Peter Stebbings. With Woody Harrelson, Elias Koteas, Michael Kelly, Sandra Oh. Arthur Poppington, a regular man who adopts a superhero persona, known as "Defendor", combs the city streets at night, in search of his archenemy, Captain Industry." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1303828/","name":"Defendor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM4MjI5MzcwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDEzMjkxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Arthur Poppington, a regular man who adopts a superhero persona, known as "Defendor", combs the city streets at night, in search of his archenemy, Captain Industry.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1303828/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"duff-579-22069"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Defendor YES","reviewBody":"The only reason I can think of why a person would give this movie a bad review is that it wasn't the movie they expected. I liked it from the first minute to the last, and I didn't know what to expect. I can't think of a single flaw in this very low budget film, so in comparison to some of the disappointing big popular movies out there that have expensive visible flaws, I give Defendor a big YES. Woody did a very good job on this film. I can see by his performance that he enjoyed making it and I enjoyed watching him.

I was disappointed in Woody Harrelson's previous acting in the "2012" monstrous mess where he painfully overacted and seemed to be telling the audience that it was all a bad joke. Defendor made up for that.

Woody proved that you don't have to have expensive green-screen special effects to make a good movie. It can be done with acting talent. Thank you Woody! 

Relax your mind, see the movie, let yourself enjoy it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36294,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2010-05-13","keywords":"vigilante,superhero,gun running,organized crime,pimp","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Defendor: U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi554959897","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0NDgxMjkwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTIwNTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0NDgxMjkwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTIwNTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A comedy centered around three characters: an everyday guy who comes to believe he's a superhero, his psychiatrist, and the teenager he befriends."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000437/","name":"Woody Harrelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0993507/","name":"Kat Dennings"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0644897/","name":"Sandra Oh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824220/","name":"Peter Stebbings"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0255931/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005584/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133523/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824220/","name":"Peter Stebbings"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

I liked it from the first minute to the last, and I didn't know what to expect. I can't think of a single flaw in this very low budget film, so in comparison to some of the disappointing big popular movies out there that have expensive visible flaws, I give Defendor a big YES. Woody did a very good job on this film. I can see by his performance that he enjoyed making it and I enjoyed watching him.

I was disappointed in Woody Harrelson's previous acting in the "2012" monstrous mess where he painfully overacted and seemed to be telling the audience that it was all a bad joke. Defendor made up for that.

Woody proved that you don't have to have expensive green-screen special effects to make a good movie. It can be done with acting talent. Thank you Woody!
